alert.note: Alert for Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 4:48PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Raleigh and southwestern Fayette Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 447 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fayetteville, moving southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Fayetteville, Oak Hill, Mount Hope, Ansted, Bradley, Prosperity, Hawks Nest State Park, Daniels, Piney View, Stanaford, Beaver, Shady Spring, Macarthur, Powellton, Pax, Thurmond, Dorothy and Artie. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 45 and 65. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 123 and 126. Route 19 between mile markers 1 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
